keywords: Groundcover, Vegetation, Estimation, Transects, Percentage, CHaMP method, Riparian Structure, Peck et al. methods

abstract: In simple terms, this method is used to determine the percentage of groundcover (vegetation) and percentage of bare ground (no vegetation) within a 10m x 10m plot located at bankfull level in a riverbank area. This assessment is carried out at five different locations on both sides of the plot. The method, known as Percent Ground Cover or CHaMP Riparian Structure Method, provides an average percentage of groundcover and percentage of bare ground for each plot. These measurements help in understanding the health and structure of the riparian zone, which is essential for maintaining a balanced ecosystem and preventing erosion. The data collected is based on previous methods developed by Peck et al. (2001) used by the Environmental Monitoring and Assessment Program (EMAP). More details about this method can be found at http://www.monitoringmethods.org/Method/Details/845.

description:
In accordance with the CHaMP - Riparian Structure Method (CHaMP, 2021), an assessment of the extent of riparian groundcover vegetated and bare is conducted. This evaluation is based on five randomly situated transects, numbered 1, 6, 11, 16, and 21, within a defined 10m x 10m plot. The measurement process begins at bankfull level.

For each plot, the percentage of groundcover area (<0.5 m aboveground) is visually estimated at every transect. The Percent GroundCover value is obtained by averaging these individual percentages across all ten plots. Conversely, Percent GroundcoverNoCover is calculated as 100% minus Percent GroundCover.

The CHaMP methodology adheres to the protocols outlined in Peck et al. (2001), as employed by the EMAP (Environmental Monitoring and Assessment Program). For a more comprehensive understanding of this procedure, refer to the detailed documentation provided at http://www.monitoringmethods.org/Method/Details/845.

3. Percent GroundCover is an average of the estimates from each of these 10 plots. (Constraint on data analysis: averaging of data from multiple plots)
4. The CHaMP - Riparian Structure Method provides background on the measurements that are analyzed for this calculation. (Background information, not a constraint per se, but important context for understanding the method)
5. Percent GroundcoverNoCover is 100-Percent GroundCover. (Mathematical definition of a derived variable)
